This is to certify as a member and guest of the Intomation I Civil
Acronautics. Conference, called by President Colin Coolidge, to
mark the first quarter century of human A
Munt; I accompanied Hon.
Orville Wright from Washinsten, D. C. to Kill Devil Hill, N. C.
On the entire pilgrimage I carried this commemorative cover
and finally mailed it personally at the place and on the date as
postmarked.
(Signed) B. B. LIPSNER

properties.sfomuseum:description: Airmail flight cover commemorating the 25th anniversary of the first aircraft flight (Wright brothers)on December 17, 1903; off-white envelope with blue and silver preprinted cachet with image of columns with names of aviation pioneers, with second preprinted orange cachet with image of winged man (likely Icarus), third stamped black cachet with image of biplane; signed by Captain B.B. Lipsner; postmarked December 17, 1928 in Kitty Hawk, North Carolina with four-bar cancellation mark over 5-cent stamp; backstamp: December 19, 1928, Chicago; reverse features green stamped certificate (unsigned) verifying that Orville Wright participated in the flight.
properties.wof:name: airmail flight cover: Wright Brothers first flight, 25th Anniversary
